administrative.name: Metal Salts Experiment
administrative.description:
Enables the comparison of metal concentrations (zinc, copper and cadmium) at 3 rates applied as metal salts and with no additional organic matter. 
Periodic soil and plant samples are available in the Rothamsted Sample Archive. 
This experiment is part of a network of 3 sites across the UK and can also be compared with related Contaminated Sludge Cake Experiment and Metal Amended Liquid Sludge Experiment, also at Woburn.
administrative.disambiguatingDescription: To study the effects of zinc, copper and cadmium as metal salts on soil microbial activity

dataAccess.conditionsOfAccess: Available to any researcher on request
dataAccess.actionableFeedbackPolicy: To study the effects of zinc, copper and cadmium as metal salts on soil microbial activity
dataAccess.correctionsPolicy: To study the effects of zinc, copper and cadmium as metal salts on soil microbial activity

citation.citation: Chaudri, A. , McGrath, S. , Gibbs, P. , Chambers, B. , Carlton-Smith, C. , Bacon, J. , Campbell, C. and Aitken, M. (2008) "Population size of indigenous Rhizobium leguminosarum biovar trifolii in long-term field experiments with sewage sludge cake, metal-amended liquid sludge or metal salts: Effects of zinc, copper and cadmium", Soil Biology & Biochemistry, 40, 1670-1680
